meanings.sent1: After lunch, she will reenter the classroom to continue learning.
meanings.sent2: He forgot his keys at home and had to reenter the house to get them.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to reenter the room through the closed window, thinking it was open.
meanings.sent4: The memories of his childhood reentered his mind like a sudden storm.
meanings.sent5: The astronaut had to reenter the spaceship carefully to avoid any accidents.

meanings.definition: To return to a place or activity
meanings.sent1: After the break, the students will reenter the classroom quietly.
meanings.sent2: She had to reenter the gym to retrieve her water bottle.
meanings.sent3: The magician pretended to reenter the stage with a grand flourish.
meanings.sent4: The lost hiker finally found the trail to reenter the forest.
meanings.sent5: The detective decided to reenter the crime scene to look for more clues.

meanings.definition: To rejoin a group or organization
meanings.sent1: After his suspension, he was allowed to reenter the team and play again.
meanings.sent2: She had to reenter the club after resolving the misunderstanding.
meanings.sent3: The prodigal son was welcomed back to reenter the family business.
meanings.sent4: The retired professor decided to reenter the academic community.
meanings.sent5: The musician was excited to reenter the band and perform on stage once more.
